alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Somerset; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ocean, eastern Mercer, northeastern Burlington, south central Somerset, southern Monmouth and southwestern Middlesex Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 516 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cedar Glen Lakes, or 14 miles west of Toms River, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Manalapan, Barnegat, Princeton, Beachwood, Hightstown, Bordentown, Cranbury, Presidential Lakes Estates, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Allentown, Pemberton, Roosevelt, Wrightstown, Rocky Hill, Six Flags Theme Park and Jacksonville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 8A. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 26. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 51 and 67. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 65 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Somerset; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth
